org.xbmc.httpapi.client

Class VideoClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xbmc.httpapi.client.Client
      • org.xbmc.httpapi.client.VideoClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IClient, IVideoClient

    public class VideoClient
extends Client
implements IVideoClient
    Takes care of everything related to the video database.
    Author:
    Team XBMC

      • getCover

        public Bitmap getCover(INotifiableManager manager,
              ICoverArt cover,
              int size)
        Returns a pre-resized movie cover. Pre-resizing is done in a way that the bitmap at least as large as the specified size but not larger than the double.
        Specified by:
        getCover in interface IVideoClient
        Parameters:
        manager - Postback manager
        cover - Cover object
        size - Minmal size to pre-resize to.
        Returns:
        Thumbnail bitmap

      • parseMovies

        private java.util.ArrayList<Movie> parseMovies(java.lang.String response)
        Converts query response from HTTP API to a list of Movie objects. Each row must return the following attributes in the following order:
        1. idMovie
        2. c00
          3. (title)
        3. c07
          4. (year)
        4. strPath
        5. strFileName
        6. c15
          7. (director)
        7. c11
          8. (runtime)
        8. c14
          9. (genres)
        9. c05
          10. (rating)
        10. playCount
          11. (numWatched)
        11. c09
          12. (imdbId)
        Parameters:
        response -
        Returns:
        List of movies

      • parseMovieDetails

        private Movie parseMovieDetails(java.lang.String response,
                      Movie movie)
        Updates a movie object with some more details. Fields must be the following (in this order):
        1. c03
          2. (tagline)
        2. c01
          3. (plot)
        3. c04
          4. (number of votes)
        4. c18
          5. (studio)
        5. c12
          6. (parental rating)
        6. c19
          7. (trailer)
        Parameters:
        response -
        movie -
        Returns:
        Updated movie object

      • parseActors

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Actor> parseActors(java.lang.String response)
        Converts query response from HTTP API to a list of Actor objects. Each row must return the following columns in the following order:
        1. idActor
        2. strActor
        Parameters:
        response -
        Returns:
        List of Actors

      • parseActorRoles

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Actor> parseActorRoles(java.lang.String response)
        Converts query response from HTTP API to a list of Actor objects with roles attached. Each row must return the following columns in the following order:
        1. idActor
        2. strActor
        3. strRole
        Parameters:
        response -
        Returns:
        List of Actors

      • parseGenres

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Genre> parseGenres(java.lang.String response)
        Converts query response from HTTP API to a list of Genre objects. Each row must return the following columns in the following order:
        1. idGenre
        2. strGenre
        Parameters:
        response -
        Returns:
        List of Genres

      • setPlaylistPosition

        public boolean setPlaylistPosition(INotifiableManager manager,
                          int position)
        Sets the media at playlist position to be the next item to be played.
        Specified by:
        setPlaylistPosition in interface IVideoClient
        Parameters:
        position - New position, starting with 0.
        Returns:
        True on success, false otherwise.

      • getPlaylist

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        Videos in the playlist.

      • removeFromPlaylist

        public boolean removeFromPlaylist(INotifiableManager manager,
                         java.lang.String path)
        Removes media from the current playlist. It is not possible to remove the media if it is currently being played.
        Specified by:
        removeFromPlaylist in interface IVideoClient
        Parameters:
        position - Complete path (including filename) of the media to be removed.
        Returns:
        True on success, false otherwise.
